text:
More than 20 people were killed and more than 100 injured in a shooting incident at the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino late on Sunday, October 1, according to Las Vegas authorities. Sheriff Joseph Michael Lombardo confirmed shortly after the shooting that the suspect was killed by police. He said police were seeking Marilou Danley, an associate of the primary suspect. Credit: Las Vegas PD via Storyful

CELINE DION, Mariah Carey and Susanna Reid have led tributes to the victims of the Las Vegas shooting.

Country singer Jason Aldean has also posted on Instagram to reassure fans after his Vegas show was cut short by rounds of gunfire, The Sun reports.

The country singer shared an Instagram picture of the Nevada city and the caption “Pray For Las Vegas”.

Tonight has been beyond horrific. I still dont know what to say but wanted to let everyone know that Me and my Crew are safe. My Thoughts and prayers go out to everyone involved tonight. It hurts my heart that this would happen to anyone who was just coming out to enjoy what should have been a fun night. #heartbroken #stopthehate A post shared by Jason Aldean (@jasonaldean) on Oct 2, 2017 at 1:17am PDT

He wrote: “Tonight has been beyond horrific. I still don’t know what to say but wanted to let everyone know that Me and my Crew are safe. My thoughts and prayers go out to everyone involved tonight. It hurts my heart that this would happen to anyone who was just coming out to enjoy what should have been a fun night.”

VEGAS MASSACRE: Worst shooting in US history

GUNMAN’S BROTHER: ‘He just snapped’

More than 50 people are dead and more than 500 wounded after a gunman sprayed thousands of bullets into music festival crowds from a Las Vegas hotel balcony.

The terrifying moment Jason fled the stage after hearing rounds of gunfire was captured on video.

Gunfire can be heard breaking out as Jason Aldean​ performed in Las Vegas; at least 50 people are dead, 200 injured https://t.co/Fg1inPTxhn pic.twitter.com/QZ1WllHKjp — ABC News (@ABC) October 2, 2017

More footage shows blood-soaked crowds running in terror from the Route 91 country music festival after hundreds of rounds were fired from a nearby Mandalay Bay Resort Casino balcony.

Several stars — many of whom have been regular performers in Las Vegas — took to Twitter to share their thoughts and prayers for those affected.

Horrified to hear about the shooting in #LasVegas. My thoughts are with the victims and their families. Praying for everyone's safety 🙏💔 — Mariah Carey (@MariahCarey) October 2, 2017

Praying for all the innocent victims and their families in Las Vegas - Céline xx... #LasVegas — Celine Dion (@celinedion) October 2, 2017

Horrific situation in Las Vegas - two people reported dead, many injured after shooter opened fire on fans at an open-air music festival — Susanna Reid (@susannareid100) October 2, 2017

Mariah Carey wrote: “Horrified to hear about the shooting in Las Vegas. My thoughts are with the victims and their families. Praying for everyone’s safety.”

Mariah had earlier been chatting to Good Morning Britain’s Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid about her Christmas tour just after news of the shooting broke.

Meanwhile Celine Dion, who is a regular performer in the city, tweeted: “Praying for all the innocent victims and their families in Las Vegas.”

The Body Coach Joe Wicks — who is currently in Las Vegas — was forced to reassure fans he was safe, tweeting: “Thank you for all your messages. I am in Las Vegas tonight and am safe in my hotel room now. Thoughts to the victims Love Joe.”

I can't believe what just happened in Las Vegas! What is our world coming to?! 😭 My prayers go out to the victims & their families. 🙏 — Paris Hilton (@ParisHilton) October 2, 2017

Can't believe my eyes. My prayers are with everyone in #Vegas. Please take shelter. This is unreal. 😞 praying for your safety. — Christina Milian (@ChristinaMilian) October 2, 2017

My heart is breaking for everyone in Vegas tonight. Simply devastating. So much loss. — Kelly Clarkson (@kelly_clarkson) October 2, 2017

CBB’s Cami Li — who has been holidaying in Vegas, tweeted: “Our server from Friday has been shot,” adding: “Won’t be sleeping tonight. My heart goes out to all those affected. This is a scary world we live in.”

As the news broke in the UK, many celebrities were stunned by the news.

Good Morning Britain’s Susanna Reid tweeted as the news first broke: “Horrific situation in Las Vegas — two people reported dead, many injured after shooter opened fire on fans at an open-air music festival.”

Thoughts and prayers go out to all those in Las Vegas💜 what is this world coming to.. 😔 — Chloë Crowhurst (@chloecrowhurst_) October 2, 2017

Shane Richie tweeted: “Watching the news unfold from Vegas is heartbreaking. My thoughts and prayers are with all out there now.”

Megan McKenna, who has been hoping to build a career as a country singer, wrote: “Waking up to the awful news about the shooting in Vegas. Praying for everyone’s safety, my thoughts are with the victims & their families.”

Lord Sugar added: “Terrible atrocity in Las Vegas. News changing every hour. Our thoughts go to relatives and friends of whose who died and are badly injured.”

Las Vegas Hotels Placed on Lockdown Following Concert Shooting. Credit - Twitter/Martin Fogarty via Storyful 0:25 A number of Las Vegas hotels were placed on lockdown following the mass shooting at the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino late on Sunday, October 1. More than 50 people were killed and more than 200 injured, police said. Sheriff Joseph Michael Lombardo confirmed shortly after the shooting that the suspect, 64-year-old Stephen Pollack, was killed by police. Mandalay Bay, the MGM Grand and the Tropicana remained on lockdown in the early hours of Monday, with guests being told to stay in their rooms, the Las Vegas Review-Journal reported":https://www.reviewjournal.com/local/the-strip/it-was-a-horror-show-mass-shooting-leaves-more-than-50-dead-200-wounded-on-las-vegas-strip/. The video shows people gathering in the Tropicana hotel. Credit: Twitter/Martin Fogarty via Storyful

This story originally appeared in The Sun and has been republished here with permission.
title: Las Vegas shooting: Celine Dion, Mariah Carey lead celebrity tributes to massacre victims

meta_data.description: CELINE DION, Mariah Carey and Susanna Reid have led tributes to the victims of the Las Vegas shooting.

og.title: Celine, Mariah honour massacre victims
og.description: CELINE DION, Mariah Carey and Susanna Reid have led tributes to the victims of the Las Vegas shooting.
